loans.name: Lourdes Iris

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes de 37  años de edad, vive con su esposo y  tiene 01 hijo  que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia, en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo,  valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Lourdes se dedica desde hace 10 años  al negocio de venta de comida, golosinas y fresco natural, su venta es ambulante en el mercado de Nacaome.
Doña Lourdes está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de repollo, cebolla, chiles, tomates, pastas, plátanos, yuca, etc.  Y también ocupa una parte para realizarle unas pequeñas mejoras a su casa, con el apoyo de este préstamo desea que  mejoren  sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
Doña Lourdes es un cliente que solicita su octavo préstamo, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida y también ampliar su casa, está muy contenta por el apoyo de Prisma a su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras- Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and has one dependent child. They live in their own home, in a community in San Lorenzo, in the southern valley of Honduras.

Lourdes has been working for ten years selling food, sweets, and natural drinks. She works as a street vendor in the market of Nacaome.

Lourdes is requesting this loan to buy cabbagge, onions, chiles, tomatoes, pasta, plantains, cassava, etc. She also needs part of it to make some improvements to her home. She wants to use the help from this loan to improve her income and, in turn, her quality of life.

Lourdes is a client requesting her eighth loan. Her dream is to improve her business and her quality of life, as well as to add on to her house. She is very happy with the support her business receives from Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2013

loans.use: to buy cabbagge, onions, chiles, tomatoes, pasta, plantains, cassava, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 36 years old. She runs a butcher shop, selling meat, and has been running her business for the past three years. 

She wants the loan to buy more cows so that she can slaughter them for getting more meat for sale. 

She will use the profits from the business to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Celestino De Jesús

texts.es:
Celestino de 35 años,  debido a la condición económica de sus padres y ademas era una familia bastante numerosa no le pudieron dar el estudio, ya que tenían que trabajar todo el día y mantener la familia debido a que era el mayor de sus hermanos. Esta acompañado y su compañera de vida, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, vive con ella y sus 3 hijos quienes están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, también vive su madre con ellos, le ayuda en la agricultura ya que su padre ya fallecido y era quien se dedicaba a esta labor.

Celestino se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz, desde que estaba muy pequeño, trabajaba junto con su padre y sus hermanos  quienes aprendieron muy bien a esta actividad, actualmente cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, también se dedica a trabajar como jornal al cuidado de animales.

Tiene que levantarse a las 3 de la mañana, ya que tiene que ordeñar 10 vacas donde trabaja como jornal y para la época de invierno, después de hacer todo el trabajo tiene que irse a donde tiene sus cultivos y es a un kilómetro de su casa y por las tardes se dirige a traer los animales en donde los dejan todo el día para que puedan comer.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes y abonos,  para la posterior recolección de la cosecha de maíz y de frijol.

Él aspira a futuro sacar adelante a sus hijos, en el estudio. Ademas, construir una mejor vivienda para su familia, las ganancias del crédito los utiliza en la compra de animales de granja .
texts.en:
Because of his parents’ economic condition and because of the large number of family members his parents had to work all day to support the family and since Celestino, 35, was the oldest among his brothers he had to help them work so he was unable to go to school.

He’s now in a relationship and his life companion does domestic chores.  He lives with her and their three children who are attending school in the community.  His mother lives with them too and helps him with the agriculture since his father is deceased; he used to be the one to help him.

Celestino has been growing corn since he was little.   He used to work alongside his father and brothers and learned this activity very well.  He’s currently growing 7,000 square meters of corn and he also works as a laborer caring for livestock.

He must rise at 3am because he has to milk 10 cows where he’s employed as a day laborer and in winter after doing all his work he must go to where his crop is growing which is a kilometer from home and then return in the evening to bring back the livestock from the pastures where they spend all day feeding.

The loan he’s asking for is to buy fertilizer and manure for the upcoming corn and bean harvests.  He hopes in future to move his children forward with their schooling and also to build a better house for his family.  He will use profits from the loan to buy farm animals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy meat, noodles, vegetables, spices, rice, seasonings, and other ingredients for her business.

Elisa has been in this business for 9 years. She earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, noodles, vegetables, spices, rice, seasonings, and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luis Alfonso se dedica a su actividad desde hace 20 años vende en su casa de habitacion en el municipio de el Viejo. el señor Luis Alfonso se esfuerza por salir adelante, sacar con mucho esfuerzo a su hija que esta en edad escolar y a su madre que es una señora de edad avanzada, empezo su negoico con capital propiio, vendiendo carne de res en el mercado del Viejo y poco a poco le fue comprando mercaderia a su pequeña pulperia, solicita el financiamiento para compra de productos de primera nesecidad para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis Alfonso has been working in his activity selling at home in the town El Viejo for 20 years.  Luis Alfonso strives to get ahead and with much effort move his school age daughter forward; he also supports his elderly mother.

He started his business with his own capital selling  beef in the El Viejo market and gradually bought merchandise for his small grocery store.  He’s requesting the loan to buy basic staples to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
Felix de 61 años de edad, casado con hijos mayores de edad, originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Desde muy joven de dedico a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar por falta de recursos económicos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa,  comesticos, y productos comestibles como:  pantalones, short, camisas, vestidos, faldas, toallas, ropa interior, ropa de cam, rubor, labiales, crema de cuerpos, arroz, frijoles, fosforos, jugos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación de forma ambulante por encargo a clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de mercadería  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Felix agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Felix, who is 61 years old, is married and has two adult children. He is from Leon, which is located in the western area of the country. He is known to be hardworking and responsible, and for his drive to improve himself. Ever since he was very young, he worked in order to help with home expenses, due to lacking financial resources.

Thanks to his effort and his will to get ahead, he has a business selling clothing, cosmetics, and food items, such as pants, shorts, shirts, dresses, skirts, towels, underwear, bedding, rouge, lipstick, body lotions, rice, beans, matches, and juice. His business is located in his home and he also sells door-to-door to regular and occasional customers. He dedicates about eight hours a day to his business, offering his products. 

The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital by purchasing merchandise to stock his business so that he can earn a higher income in the near future. Felix appreciates the help Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources from poor countries like Nicaragua in order for them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise like pants, shorts, shirts, dresses, skirts, towels, underwear, and bedding.

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Eufracia is taking a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, salt, eggs, milk, beer, water biscuits, and soft drinks such as Sagiko, Fanta, Coca Cola, and Sprite. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. Eufracia is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, salt, eggs, milk, beer, water biscuits, and soft drinks such as Sagiko, Fanta, Coca Cola, and Sprite

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya is an experienced farmer from the Gosh village of Tavush region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and mother.  Ofelya's husband works for the railway, and her daughter-in-law works at school. However, their salaries are not enough to meet the needs of the family. 

Ofelya is engaged in cattle breeding, in beekeeping, and in the cultivation of beans, potatoes, cucumbers, grass, plums, and apples. Her son helps her in realizing the agricultural products in the local market. All the family work hard to earn a living.  

The barn for the cattle is currently in poor condition and needs to be renovated. A loan of USD 500 will be a huge help to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to renovate the barn. 

Ofelya and her family rely on the good will of the lenders.  They will be grateful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to run their agribusiness in more efficient way.

loans.use: to renovate her cattle barn

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Los Ángeles está conformado por 12 personas, madres y padres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, pero luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracia a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es Yanett y tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería en su casa de habitación. una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jugos, gaseosas, huevos, queso, crema, fósforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, actividad que la realiza en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Los Ángeles agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Los Ángeles communal bank consists of 12 people, responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children in their care.  They are from Malpaisillo, a place located in the country’s north.  These folks are noted for being hardworking, responsible and with a strong wish for self-improvement.  Sadly, they were unable to study for lack of economic resources but they strive daily to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her effort and drive to get ahead, Yanett’s the bank coordinator and her economic activity is a home-based “pulpería” which is a small store selling grocery items like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soft-drinks, juice, eggs, cream, cheese and matches in small amounts.  She spends about 12 hours in her store daily selling her goods, an activity that takes place at home.

The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital to stock the store with grocery items to sell so that in the not too distant future she’ll earn higher income.

The Los Ángeles communal bank thanks Kiva lenders for the support they provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is doing well in his businesses and he has been servicing his loan well. He has borrowed a loan of KES 100,000. He would like to buy 20 bags of maize and ten bags of beans for resale during this period of harvesting. Kenneth will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock for his business. He is currently earning a monthly income of KES 45,000.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of maize and ten bags of beans for resale.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, 44, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, an employee, and is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Rosemarie maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a credit that he or she must pay within the month. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers count on as income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Rosemarie hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of being able to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is 60 years old, married, and lives with his wife, school-age son, and a retired aunt, in the small village of Oktomberi (“October” in English). 

Vakhtang’s wife helps him to run a small-scale farm with two milk cows, two calves, and a pig. The family produces cheese with the received milk and sells it locally. In addition, they grow nuts, pineapples, guava, and kiwi on the family-owned land and they sell harvested products at the local open market.  

Since the income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses, Vakhtang decided to set up a workshop in his yard to generate an income. He used to work as a joiner, and he has rich experience in this field. 

With the loan, Vakhtang will buy a joiner’s desk and all the other necessary equipment needed to start the workshop. He will work on special orders to serve local people. This start-up credit will be a great help for the family to increase their monthly income and improve their living conditions. Vakhtang thanks all Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: to start a joiner's workshop.

loans.name: Raneem

texts.en: Raneem is 23 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her 5 siblings and her parents. Raneem is in her fourth year studying for a Bachelor of Child Raising. She is planning to continue her studies to work in her field after graduation. This will allow her to help her family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay her upcoming semester's fees.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik is a farmer from Lusaghbyur village in the Shirak region. He lives with his wife and school age son.

To take care of his family, Norik is engaged in breeding livestock - cows, sheep, hens, pigs and piglets - and in the cultivation of wheat. He sells the agricultural products in the local market.

Norik owns agricultural machinery which helps him greatly in his everyday farming activities. His agricultural machinery currently needs to be renovated in order to function properly. A loan of 3,000 USD will be a great help to this hard-working man, enabling him to purchase two wheels, renovate his agricultural machinery and buy some fuel for it. It will help him organize and run his agribusiness in a more efficient way.

Norik and his family will appreciate the lenders' support and will be grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase two wheels, renovate his agricultural machinery and buy some fuel for it

loans.name: Zhaneta

texts.en:
Zhaneta is an experienced agronomist from the Haykadzor village of the Shirak region. She lives with her husband, son, and school-age daughter. To take care of her family's needs, Zhaneta is engaged in cattle breeding, and in breeding a livestock of sheep, pigs, piglets, and hens. She is also involved in cultivation of wheat. 

Farming is a very important source of income for her family. Zhaneta's husband and son help her sell the agricultural products in the local market.  As life is getting more expensive day by day, Zhaneta needs to expand her agribusiness to be able to meet expenses. A loan of $2,000 will support her greatly, enabling her to purchase a cow, two steers, and some forage for them. 

Zhaneta and her family will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them collect the needed amount of the loan for sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, two steers, and some forage for them

loans.name: Erkhembayar

texts.en:
Mr. Erkhembayar, 29 years old, lives with his wife, daughter, and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a grocery store since 2009. His wife has a position as a sales manager at a private firm. His mother has retired from work, and looks after his eight-month-old daughter at home. 

He is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam to renovate his house. 

After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is needed for heating and consequently less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: José es padre de tres hijos, originario de Teustepe. De oficio Agricultor, dedicado al cultivo de Maíz y frijol. Se siente agradecido con Kiva y Micrédito ya que logro aumentar el cultivo de sus cosechas y  obtener mayores ingresos. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar un silo metálico, el cual sirve para conservar cultivos de Maíz y frijoles, además para pagar mano de obra de sus ayudantes. Estima que el préstamo le ayudara a garantizar una mejor calidad de sus cultivos, aumentar sus cosechas y brindar un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is father of three children.  He’s from Teustepe and works in agriculture growing corn and beans.  He’s grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he managed to increase crop yields and earn higher income.

He’s asking for a new loan to buy a metal silo that will be used to store the corn and bean and also to pay his helpers labor costs.  He figures the loan will help him guarantee better crop quality, increase yields and be able to offer better prices to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a metal silo.

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. She was born in 1963. She lives in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Marka with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a retired man.

One of Nehad's sons is currently a student in his first year of studying hostelry. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation to start helping Nehad and her husband financially as they are facing a financial crisis which does not let them pay for her son's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Norma Yessenia

texts.es:
Norma de 36 años, estudio hasta  bachillerato, es madre soltera de tres hijos, todos asisten a la escuela. El negocio que tiene es elaborar  pan  un día de por medio y comercializarlo, con los vecinos en su comunidad, este trabajo lo aprendió de su madre,  ella solo a ese trabajo realiza, lo hace en su propia casa lo vende por la tarde.

Con el crédito pretende comprar los materiales para la elaboración del pan, como lo es la leche, la harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos, vainilla y  leña para calentar el horno artesanal. El crédito mejorara el negocio, ya que debido al dinero no cubre la demanda de sus clientes, en variedad, calidad y cantidad, le ayudará a generar mayores ingresos, lo que le dará a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.


A futuro, espera seguir aumentando el negocio, comprar un horno que le facilite el trabajo, y para sus hijos quiere que sean profesionales.  Con el préstamo, podrá hacer más pan, lo que generara más ganancias, esas las utilizara en alimentación de ella y sus hijos, y otra parte la seguirá invirtiendo en el negocio, a futuro piensa que sus hijos le ayudaran en el trabajo y lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Norma, 36, completed high-school.  She’s a single mother of three children all of whom attend school.  The business she has is baking bread to sell every day to neighbors in her community; she learned this work from her mother.  This is her only work and she does it at home and sells in the afternoon.

She intends to use the loan to buy bread-baking supplies like milk, flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, vanilla and firewood to heat the artisanal oven.  The loan will improve her business because lack of money makes her unable to meet customer demand with respect to variety, quality and quantity.  It will help her generate higher income which will give her family better economic stability.

In future, she’d like to continue increasing her business and to buy an oven that will make her work easier and also to see her children become professionals.  With the loan she will be able to bake more bread which will generate higher profits that she’ll use for her and her children’s daily food needs.  She will use another part to continue investing in the business.  She hopes in future that her children will help her in the business and to reach her dreams.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase different ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, baking powder, shortening, and other ingredients needed in making bread. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jocelyn hopes that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, baking powder, shortening, and other ingredients needed in making bread

loans.name: Rukwa Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a single woman with a boy who is still a baby. She is in her mid-twenties, running a business selling home products such as plates, spoons, source pans, bowls, cups, and other dishes. She has worked at this business for three years now. Sarah works from 10 AM to 8 PM per working day and is able to make a fair return per month. 

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she managed to pay back successfully, Sarah restocked her business with more kitchen dishes. Sarah's business profit is used to cover household expenses, reinvested back to business, and saved into her bank account. She will use this loan to restock more home dishes to resell. Sarah dreams of building a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group  "Rukwa" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more home dishes to resell.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is 64, and trades in small dry fish. She is a married woman whose spouse provides the additional income; together they support four children  and have been in the fish business for the past five years.

This marks Dama's fourth borrowing from KADET Ltd to finance her business. She will use the loan to increase her dry fish stock, and to open up other outlets in the market at her village. With the anticipated profit, Dama will pay her loan as well as pay her daughter's college fee. 

She hopes to see her businesses grow in the near future to wholesale fish selling.

loans.use: to increase her dry fish stock and open outlets in the market

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Juan Pablo Group

texts.es:
SANDY CRISTY, tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 7 años, quien es el motor que la impulsa a salir adelante, a esforzarse cada día para poder brindarle lo necesario para su desarrollo.
Ella, forma parte del grupo "Los Emprendedores de Juan Pablo", es un grupo recientemente formado, con seis integrantes, todos ellos vecinos con una misma meta que es hacer crecer sus negocios. 
Sandy Cristy se dedica a la venta de menú desde hace un poco mas de un año, realiza esta actividad en un mercado de la zona donde vive, trabaja todos los días, termina la venta de todos los platos que ofrece, pero le gustaría invertir un poco mas para poder aumentar clientela y así aumentar sus ganancias.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, papa, aceites, todos estos productos que puede comprar a precio por mayor y que puede conservar.
texts.en:
Sandy Cristy, 23, has a 7-year-old son who is the motor that pushes her to get ahead and to strive daily to be able to provide him with everything needed for his development.

She’s part of the “Los Emprendedores de Juan Pablo” (John Paul’s Entrepreneurs) group which is a recently formed group with six members who are all neighbors with the same goal: to make their businesses grow.

Sandy Cristy has been selling prepared lunches for a little more than a year.  She does so in a market near where she lives.  She works every day and sells out all the dishes she prepares but she’d like to invest a little more to increase her clientele and her profits.

The loan she got will be used to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, potatoes and oil.  She wants to buy all these storable products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Flor De Rosa

texts.es:
Flor de Rosa tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su esposo, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Lagunas, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo que esta ubicada en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos descartables, cerveza y gaseosas, desde hace mas de 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer variedad de productos, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Flor de Rosa, 51, lives with her husband in a large community in the Lagunas urban zone belonging to Chiclayo Province in Lambayeque Region on Peru’s north coast.

She has sold disposable items, beer and soft-drinks for over three years.  Her business is home-based and she’s asked for a 1,500 new sol loan to expand the business and offer a wider variety of goods to generate higher family income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik is an experienced farmer from Tatev village of Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, daughter a school-age son. 

To take care of his family, Rudik is engaged in cattle breeding and in beekeeping. He also cultivates beans, potatoes, grass, apples and walnuts. Rudik's wife helps him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

As the autumn is progressing, Rudik needs to make some investments in his agribusiness. He needs a loan of USD 2,850 to purchase forage for his cattle. It will help him maintain his agribusiness. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Rudik was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Rudik and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for his cattle.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cecelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Cecelia is borrowing PHP 10,000 (Philippine pesos) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak is from Gyumri city in the Shirak region. He lives with his wife and daughter. Arshak and his wife work as teachers at school. Their salaries, however, are so low that they cannot afford a living, based on their salaries alone. 

Arshak is engaged in beekeeping, which is an important source of income for the family. He sells the honey in the local market. As life is getting more expensive day-by-day, Arshak needs to obtain new beehives to be able to meet the needs of his family. 

A loan of USD 1,000 will be great support to Arshak and his family, helping him to purchase 15 beehives. Arshak has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately he wasn't able to return it. However, thanks to hard work during the recent times, he was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. 

The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Arshak and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to collect the needed loan and to sustain their lives.

loans.use: to purchase 15 beehives.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman who has been blessed with four children, three in school and one underage. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rental bills.

Kanze operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenya Shillings) to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 21 years old. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her nine siblings and her parents. One of her brothers is in the military. 

Mary is studying for a Bachelor’s of Biology, fourth year. As she is one step closer to graduation, she is planning to work in her study field after graduation to start helping her family financially. Her family is currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them in paying for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 31 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 1. Her hometown is Kitwe, located in the copperbelt of Zambia.  She operates her own Zoona mobile money business in Choma, which is in the southern province of Zambia.  

Angelina is a nurse by profession. In September, 2012, she decided to start her own business because her salary was too low to sustain the needs of her growing family.  When asked what she enjoys most about running her business, Angelina says providing a service to people who do not have bank accounts or are intimidated by the formal banking environment makes her feel like she is contributing a needed service for her community.  She also gets enjoyment from being able to employ others now that she is a businessowner.  Currently, Angelina has two employees.
  
Angelina is requesting a loan in order to serve more customers at her shop.  Currently, she is working with a very small amount of working capital, which makes it difficult to service her growing customer base.  She constantly gets calls from her employees in regards to needing more money to serve particular customers.  The loan will go to providing her the working capital needed to serve these customers, grow her business, and make the day-to-day operations of her business more efficient. 
 
Angelina is confident that she will be able to open additional mobile money outlets.  In doing so, she will be able to earn more profits and take care of her family better.  Her long-term goal is to one day own and operate her own health clinic.

loans.use: To grow her business by increasing her ability to service more customers in need of financial services.

loans.name: Oraib

texts.en:
Oraib was born in 1969. She is married and a mother of two; her husband is a retired man. 

Oraib has been selling womens, mens, and childrens clothes for a year. She started her project selling a small quantity of clothing to her neighbors and close friends, and she found it profitable and a good financial support for her family. 

Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit and income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so, so she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Taryel

texts.en:
Taryel is 26; he has not gotten a higher education, but he is a very talented man. Taryel's parents are not working because both of them are ill. He is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place in a central bazaar, and from his home. He has one year of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs, and he has reliable providers. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings a stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and also used to make fresh punch. His monthly income is 120 AZN. 

Now Taryel wants to repair his market, but he doesn't have enough funds for that, so he needs a loan of 1,000 AZN.

This is the first loan he is receiving through Aqroinvest . He hadn't gotten other loans from state banks before.

loans.use: to repair his market

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 61-year-old shopkeeper in Voi Kenya. He is a married man who his six grandchildren.His wife earns additional income. He has been in this business for the last six years and has done great.

This marks his fourth borrowing to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase shop stock of wheat and maize flour, a sack of sugar and washing detergents. He will use the anticipated profit to service his loan and educate his grandchildren. He hopes to have a successful business and pass it on to the grandchildren,

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, sugar and washing detergents

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik is from Ararat city of the Ararat region. He lives with his wife and two school age sons (16 and 10 years old). Garnik works in the private sector, and his wife works at school as a teacher. Both of them work hard to earn a living for their family. Their salaries, however, are so low that they can hardly cover the increasing needs of the family. Garnik is also engaged in cultivation of tomatoes, peaches, and apricots. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. 

As the autumn is progressing, Garnik needs to make some investments in his agribusiness in order for it to develop in a sustainable way. He needs a loan of $1,200 to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to pay for harvesting services. Garnik and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is 30 years old and married with six children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko) hard drinks (beer) salt, milk, cigarettes, noodles, biscuits, water, coffee and sugar. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $100. Maria is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, hard drinks (beer), salt, milk, cigarettes, noodles, biscuits, water, coffee and sugar

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayalti, en la casa de sus padres a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que está ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El es conocido en el medio por su labor de confección de prendas de vestir, y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de material (telas, hilos) para surtir su negocio, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Noé, 27, lives with his wife in his parents’ house in Cayalti District two hours from the city of Chiclayo located in Lambayeque Region on Peru’s north coast.

He’s known in the area for is work manufacturing articles of clothing and he’s asked for a 1,000 new sol loan to buy supplies (fabric and thread) to stock his business to earn additional family income.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 51 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, sanitary napkins, etc. in her general store.

Elma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, sanitary napkins, etc. 

Elma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Khangaimaa

texts.en:
Khangaimaa, 50 years old, lives with her son, daughter, son-in-law, and grandchild in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store since 2003 and her daughter supplies goods and products from the wholesale market. Her son in law works at a construction site. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT (Mongolia Tughriks) to buy an electric car. The advantage of the electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The car will be used by her son for a taxi service as an additional income source.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Movses

texts.en:
Movses is an experienced agronomist from Ararat city of Ararat region. He lives with his wife, parents, and elderly grandmother. Movses and his father work in the private sector. To be able to meet his family's needs, Movses in engaged in breeding a livestock of cows and hens, and in cultivation of tomato, grass, and some fruits (apricots, peaches, pomegranates, grapes). He sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

To run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, he needs a loan of $2,550 to buy some forage for livestock, to pay for harvesting services, and to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery.  Movses has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, he has been able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover monthly payments. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Movses and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy some forage for livestock, to pay for harvesting services, and to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a hard-working and enterprising man who lives in the coastal region of Kenya.

For over three years, he has operated a clothes-selling business, selling garments for both men and women, bed sheets, and curtains. He cites seasonality as his major challenge. He dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, he wants to purchase clothes materials, bed sheets, and curtains for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes materials, bed sheets, and curtains for his business.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik, a farmer from Narek village of Ararat region, lives with his wife, two sons (five and seven years old), and his mother. To take care of his family's everyday needs, Gagik is involved in the cultivation of tomatoes, alfalfa, grapes, apples and pears. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, and they are the main source of the family's income. 

As their needs are growing day by day, Gagik must expand his agribusiness to more effectively meet the family's requirements. A loan of USD 2200 will help him greatly, enabling him to purchase three calves, pay for harvesting services, and buy fuel for agricultural machinery. He took a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to his especially hard recent work, Gagik has been able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Garik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Gagik and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three calves, pay for harvesting services and buy fuel for agricultural machinery

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik is from Vostan village, in the Ararat region. He lives with his wife and three-year-old son. 

Edik and his wife work for the police. Edik and his wife are also engaged in agriculture and in the cultivation of wheat, corn, tomatoes, apricots, and plums. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. The two of them work hard to earn a living for the family. 

Agribusiness is an important source of income for them. To continue it in a sustainable way, Edik needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase wheat seeds, buy fuel for agricultural machinery, pay for the harvesting services, pay the water bills, and pay the workforce. The loan will greatly assist him in maintaining and developing his agribusiness. 

Edik and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for their support in obtaining the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, buy fuel for agricultural machinery, pay for the harvesting services, pay the water bills, and pay for the workforce.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is aged 44 and living with her husband.

Her husband is a services provider to ceremonies; he provides the decoration lights and wedding tents for weddings, birthdays, and engagement ceremonies. He does not consider it a profitable business because this is a seasonal business. Now the marriage season is going into the peak but his tents have become clumsy due to lack of usage for a long time. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide better services to his customers. Therefore, Rehana requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy new wedding tents and decoration lights to provide the decoration services. 

Rehana says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy wedding tents for providing the decoration services for marriage ceremonies.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 54 years old and married with two children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a  12,000 PHP (Philippines Pesos)  loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Emelia has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years.

Emelia aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Carla del Socorro se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida en el mercado santa ana desde hace 20 años empezo su negocio  como ayudante de cocina de un negocio familiar, empezo su propio  negocio con ahorro, es madre soltera tiene una hija esta en edad escolar cursa su universidad y se esfuerza por sacarla adelante, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, la señora Carla solicita el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia para su negocio y tener en existencia producto.
texts.en: Carla del Socorro sells food in the Santa Ana Market.  She started working 20 years ago as a kitchen helper in a family business and started her own business with her savings.  She is a single mom and her daughter is school-age and attends university. Carla works hard to get ahead.  She works Monday to Sunday from six in the morning until five at night. She is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her business and to have merchandise in stock.

loans.use: to buy quintals of rice and sugar, cans of oil, vegetables, ingredients and sauces.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik, an experienced farmer from Aygevan village of Ararat region, lives with her husband, son, and school-age daughter (17 years old). Nazik's husband works in the private sector. To help her husband in earning a living for the family, Nazik is engaged in cattle breeding and the cultivation of alfalfa, peaches, apricots, quinces, grapes, and apples. Her son helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function in an efficient way. A loan of USD 3000 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase forage for cattle, renovate the barn, and purchase some materials for the cultivation of grapes (cables, pipes). 

Nazik and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for cattle, renovate the barn and purchase some materials (cables, pipes) for the cultivation of grapes

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 47-year-old married father of five children. He has been working in his convenience store for 14 years to provide his family with the best education and living. He is the family's main breadwinner, which forces him to put a lot of effort into supporting and developing his business to make sure it is always capable of providing for his family's needs.

Khaled is acquiring his 11th loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, with a good standing in payback history, to increase his business merchandise with specially released offers that are very encouraging to customers and profitable in his business.

Khaled is working hard to keep his business unique in his region. He is working hard on increasing his business capital, especially now that his region is facing a wide increase of population, whose needs he intends to keep on covering.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with specially released offers

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooked rice and vegetable stew in Dompoase (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for nine years. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice.

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Amini, who is in his early 40s, is married with a daughter who is in school. For 10 years now, Amini has been running two businesses, a shop selling clothes and a genge selling fruits and vegetables. He works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. per working day and is able to make a small profit per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his 15th loan request, which he will use to restock more in his clothes shop. The previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he used to restock more in both his business. He is working so hard to enable his businesses to give great return. He uses his business profit to pay school fees and household expenses. Amini is also having a culture of saving for unforeseen events. He dreams to own a three-wheel motorcycle. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Salasala" which totals 3 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more in his clothes shop.

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita, 43, is married and has six children, five of whom are still in school. For the past thirteen years she has fattened pigs to sell.

Enelita has previously taken out loans through NWTF 21 times. She is now applying for a 17,500 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is always working and saving money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married, with five children, four in school and one who is an adult. They live in their rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Luvuno has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past six months. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan, Luvuno wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling tobacco in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more tobacco to sell for her tobacco business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years.  She also earns income from raising pigs.

Evangeline has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to sell

loans.name: Samat

texts.en:
Samat is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Anthropology. Here is his story.

“To become a student of AUCA means a lot to me. It has been such a dream I have been dreaming for a long time. I grew up seeing my sister, who studied at AUCA, and today she is a successful person, who grew up both academically and professionally. AUCA gives great knowledge based on new computer technology. Here students cab develop their critical thinking, analytical thinking skills, which are very useful skills for my future. This is a place where you can meet people from all over the world. The teachers are very sociable, bright and smart. I love AUCA community, which is very friendly. All the above mentioned experience is from my studies at preparation courses at AUCA last year. Anthropology is one of the most important fields of studies and it is a basis for other fields. As AUCA give an opportunity to get loan from Kiva, I would like to apply for it, because it will greatly help me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To cover his tuition fees.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is a 31-year-old young married client with two children. He has always worked in agriculture. For six years, he has had his own crops in the zone where he plants. He produces potatoes, corn and beans to sell and to eat. He sells his potato harvest in the local market. Vusal's wife helps him in this business. 

Vusal is asking for a loan 1,000 AZN, which he will use to buy supplies like fertilizers and fungicides for the potato crop, and to prepare land to plant basic grains. His plan is to invest, to give good care to his crops and to get better production and earn profits. This is going to be his first loan. Vusal awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers and fungicides for the potato crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of yams, maize and plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of yams and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en:
Varsenik lives on a farm in Goris in Aremenia’s Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, one-year-old son and mother-in-law.

Farming is the family’s main source of income. Her husband and she breed cattle and raise pigs and chickens. Together they sell their animals in the local market.

Varsenik would like to expand and improve the farm so as to more effectively cover the family’s financial needs. A loan of 3000 USD through SEF will help her to buy three cows, her present goal.

Varsenik and her family highly rely on the good will of lenders and thank them for helping her with this loan aimed to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en:
Satenik is a young farmer from the Aravus village of the Syuniq region of Armenia. She lives with her husband, a 5-year-old son, daughters 3 and 2 years old, and her elderly pensioner grandmother. 

With the help of her husband, Satenik is engaged in breeding livestock: cows and sheep. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of their income. 

To continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Satenik needs to expand in order for it to cover the family's needs more effectively. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase 35 sheep. 

Satenik and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders.  They will appreciate their help in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 35 sheep

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von is 44 years old, married and a loving father of three children. As the breadwinner of his family, Von sells firewood while his wife sells various products for daily use from their home. Through their perseverance and hardships, they are able to make enough to support the family.

With an aim to developing his wife’s business, Von has turned to HKL for his second loan, this time for 1,000,000 KHR, to invest in her shop. He will buy sweets, snacks, drinks, home personal products and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Von is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to save enough money to afford to pay for his children’s education in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his wife's shop

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre casado y que vive junto a sus hijos en su casa propia hecha de madera. Desde muy joven le gustaba el trabajo en el campo ayudando a sus padres en distintas labores agrícolas en benefició de obtener cacao y barbasco orgánicos para el sustento de su hogar. Al crecer y con el deseo de ser independiente le pidió a sus padres le cedan media hectárea de terreno y empezar junto a su joven familia y primer hijo proyectarse un futuro propio. Con el paso de los años fue adquiriendo mejores conocimientos y tratando en cada campaña productiva obtener almendras de calidad gracias al uso de abono orgánico.
Posee dos variedades de cacao como son el de tipo normal y por injerto porque ha tratado  de llevar progresivamente una producción tecnificada esperando así obtener mejores ingresos; sin embargo mantiene aún muchos árboles de cacao orgánico produciendo de manera natural para  mantener su tradición familiar.
Desea con el tiempo aprender más técnicas para una buena producción tecnificada de cacao y mejorar sus ingresos a largo plazo. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y espera así seguir recibiendo la confianza necesaria. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo y abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a married man who lives with his children in his own house, which is constructed of wood.  Eduardo has liked working in the fields since he was very young. He would help his parents with different agricultural labors, like obtaining cacao and organic plants for the household.  As he grew and wanted to become independent, Eduardo asked his parents to grant him a half hectare of land so he could start his own future with his young family and first son.  Over the years, he gained better and better knowledge, and he tries with each productive season to obtain quality kernels by using organic compost. 
Eduardo has two varieties of cacao, the common and grafted.  He has tried to progressively bring a more technical production, hoping it will give him a better income.  Nevertheless, he maintains lots of organic cacao trees, which produce naturally in keeping with his family's tradition. 
Eduardo hopes, with time, to learn more techniques for getting a good, more technical cacao production and improve his income in the long term.  This is the second loan he is requesting from his loan agency, and Eduardo hopes they continue to place their confidence in him.  At this time, Edurado is hoping to receive 1,000 nuevos soles (USD $375) to purchase copper-wood plants and organic compost.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost and copper-wood plants.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 30 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to David who is a tailor and they are blessed with three children aged 6, 3, and 1 year.

She owns a green grocer shop where she sells fruits and vegetables. To enable her to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes, oranges, spinach, carrots, and onions, she has applied for her first loan of KSh 20,000 from Kadet Ltd. Her monthly income right now is KSh 8,000. 

Her plan is to use profits from her expanded business to educate her children, pay back her loan to Kadet Ltd. and to expand her business further.

Susan's hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful both in business and as a family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell to customers

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 42 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Evangeline has been in pig-fattening for four years and earns additional income from food-vending and a manicure/pedicure service.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: Zawadi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to renovate her business place and purchase more potatoes for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to renovate her business place and to purchase more potatoes for her business

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is an agronomist from Lorut village of Lori region. He lives with his wife, 5-year-old son, and 4-year-old daughter. To take care of his family, Roman is engaged in breeding livestock of cows, pigs, piglets, and in cultivation of grass. He sells the agricultural products in the local market.

Roman's wife helps him in his everyday activities related to farming. As the family's needs are growing with time, Roman wants to expand his agribusiness to cover the needs of his family more effectively. A loan of USD 2,000 will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase three heifers. 

Roman and his family will appreciate the lenders support and will be grateful to them for the help in collecting the needed amount of the loan for maintaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers

loans.name: God Bless Unity Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the God Bless Unity Group, from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 3,800,000.00 (Sierra Leonean Leones) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mariama is the featured leader of this group. The 43-year-old woman is married to a driver and they have four children. Mariama has been a businesswoman for three years now. She sells firewood and charcoal. 

With her share of this loan, Mariama will buy firewood and charcoal in large quantities, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal in large quantities, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 4 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming, poultry keeping. Her biggest challenge is, outbreak of diseases.

Janeth was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, because of training after given loans and before. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, when loans are repaid on time the cost will reduce.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Janeth replied the family income will increase and living standard will improve.

Janeth owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Kadiatu from Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 and 13. Her children are currently attending school. In 2008, Kadiatu established her fish business. She began her business because she needed to create her own source of income, instead of depending on her husband alone. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week.  She says that her business is doing well; she is able to increase her customer rate. .  

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 27 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school. She lives in Sanniquille the capital of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources. She did not attend school. Her husband is a farmer. 

With money from her husband, Kou was able to establish her cook shop business five years ago. She sells G.B. (dough made of cassava) and soup. She works eight hours a day from Monday to Saturday. 

Kou is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more cassava and fish for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and fish

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 29 years old, married to an officer, and they have four children, ages 7, 13, 14, and 18 who live at home and are in school. 

For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in her community. Less income is the problem she faces now. She enjoys the interactions with her customers and the profits she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children .

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in Paynesville South area. She is 32 years old and unmarried with two children, 4 and 8 years old, who live at home. The oldest child is in school. Her fiancé is a teacher.

For the past six years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. She started this with the help of her fiancé, and learned it from her friends. She enjoys the profit from the market. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol is 47 years old and a resident of Kampong Cham province. She has a common-law relationship with her husband, a farmer and loving father of five children. One of her children has settled down for marriage already and lives separately. She is a rice farmer who has been doing farming practice for more than 30 years. 

She and her husband help each other take care of their crop to ensure a better harvest, which they sell in the markets of the province. 
During rice season, this family doesn't have enough capital to purchase enough farm supplies for their crop. Therefore, she would like to apply for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy fertilizers to sow on her three-hectare farmland. She is very grateful to all lenders for their goodwill in supporting her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to sow on her three-hectare farmland.

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru:
Курбонали 45 лет. Он 20 лет своей жизни провел на скотном дворе, ухаживая за скотами. Ранее это являлась лишь дополнительным доходом. Потому что он работал плотником и имел хорошую прибыль. На сегодняшний день деятельность скотоводства является основным источником дохода в семью Курбонали. У Курбонали на скотном дворе есть 3 коровы.  И он старательно продвигается вперед, чтобы увеличить их поголовье. Иметь большое количество животных  даст Курбонали успешный бизнес в этой сфере и хорошее обеспеченное будущее. Курбонали женат. У него один сын в возрасте 19 лет трое дочерей в возрасте 18, 16 и 11 лет. Старший сын и дочь учатся в ВУЗе города Куляб, а младшие дочери учатся в школе. 
Курбонали в данный момент просит кредит, чтобы закупить достаточное количество коров и телят. Он надеется, что благодаря данному кредиту его дела пойдут в гору, и он сможет дальше думать о расширении бизнеса.
texts.en:
Qurbonali is 45 years old. He has spent 20 years of his life in the barnyard taking care of cattle. Raising cattle used to be just a side job when he was a carpenter and made good money, but now it is the main source of income for his family. Qurbonali has three cows in his barn and is diligently working to increase his herd. Having a large herd will mean that Qurbonali has a successful business and a secure future. Qurbonali is married and has a son, age 19, and three daughters, ages 18, 16, and 11. His eldest daughter and son are studying at university in Kulob, and the younger daughters are in school. 

Qurbonali has asked for a loan to purchase several cows and calves. He hopes that this loan will help his business to really take off and that he will be able to continue to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Piona managed to increase the level of stock on her table. She says she is now selling quite a wide range of products in terms of quality, size and color. Piona says the income generated has improved the living standard of the family as she is now able to pay fees for her children without any difficulties. She sees herself operating a clothing shop in the next five years. Piona is very grateful to Kiva and partners for the assistance and wishes to continue doing business with them.


Piona has requested a loan of $700.00 to buy more products for resale, this is a portion of the group's loan amount. Elizabeth was a member to this group and she left the group, Piona is now the new Group leader. After Elizabeth's exit from the group, Midia joined as a new member.

loans.use: to purchase products for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 25-year-old micro-entrepreneur who operates his own mobile money transfer business at Nakonde boarder. This is a boarder post between Zambia and Tanzania. The business is his only source of income, and he works very hard to service his customers so that he can earn additional income. 
 
Francis received his first Kiva loan in May of 2012. He said that his business changed dramatically upon receiving the loan because he had more cash at his business to serve more customers. After this, he enrolled at the University of Zambia to pursue a degree in education while simultaneously operating his mobile money business. 

Now, Francis has hired an employee to assist him with the day-to-day transactions at his business. Francis in now requesting a loan so that he can increase his cash on hand to serve more customers. Francis explains how the demand at the boarder post is very high and consequently requires a good cash flow to serve his customers more efficiently.

With his additional profit from serving more customers, Francis plans to open another outlet. His goal is to become a successful, well educated businessman in his community.

loans.use: to increase his cash on hand to be able to serve more customers and grow his mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Saviour Alfred

texts.en:
She is twenty five years old and married with two children, one of whom attends school. She has been in this business for three years, and has not employed another person. She has the capacity to add more variety of goods that can increase sales.

With her shop at a fixed location, she is likely to build relationship with all time customers, which ensures business survival. She has previously serviced three loans with Finance (SS) Limited, and paid on time. She intends to apply the proceeds of the current loan for adding more stocks to the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, onions, cooking oil, and soaps.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Rom is 39 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animal for more than a year, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband who is joining her in the picture purchases all kinds of generator to resell. He makes an income of $10 each day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. In order to improve her family’s finance, Rom is requesting a loan of $1400 to purchase second-hand generator for resale. This money will help him obtain enough capital to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand generator to repair for resale

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 50 years old.  She is widowed and resides with her son in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She has been running a tailoring shop for more than two years, earning approximately $15 daily.  Her son who is joining her in the picture runs the business of purchasing motorbikes to resell.  He makes an income of $5 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Vanna is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a sewing machine and cloth to use in the shop.  This purchase will help her expand her business and earn more income for the family.  In the future, she would like to recruit staff to assist her and to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth to use in the shop

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Moeurn is 34 years old. He is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been running his public transportation (tuk tuk) business for more than ten years, earning approximately $10 daily. His wife, joining him in the picture, has been running a beauty salon for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 each day. 

Moeum's existing tuk tuk is old, so he is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new tuk tuk to run the transportation service. This purchase will help him to attract more customers and earn more income for the family. In the future, he would like to build a new house and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new tuk tuk to run the service.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun is 42 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband, joining her in the picture, is a construction worker who makes an income of $6 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $10 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Savoeun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her to reduce her farming expenses. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Koemly

texts.en:
Koemly is 28 years old. She is single and lives with her family in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been making metal items (bracelets, silver pots) for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Koemly is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay for her brother’s tuition fee. This money will help her brother earn a bachelor’s degree and find a well-paid job. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay her brother's tuition fee.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 32 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $3 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Chantha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries add to the shop. This purchase will help her expand her business and earn more income for the family.
