In the future, she would like to rebuild her store to make it bigger, and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to add to the shop.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 46 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 each day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $5 daily. 

To feed her pig much better, Sokha is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase fodder and vaccine for feeding her pig. This purchase will help her pig grow faster. In the future, she would like to purchase a farm, run an agricultural business, and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for feeding her pig.

loans.name: Rat

texts.en: Rat is 36 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 each day. In addition, he is also involved in cultivating rice. In order to improve their farming business, Rat is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase water pump, fertilizer and rice seed for cultivation. This purchase will help her reduce farming expenses. She hopes it will provide high yield. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she want to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase water pump, fertilizer and rice seed for cultivation

loans.name: Not

texts.en: Not is 55 years old. She is widowed and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge, Khmer noodles and desserts for more than 10 years, earning approximately $5 per day. Four of her children are employed. They are garment workers and teacher. They earn about $15 daily. Due to the lack of funds, Not is requesting a loan of $500 to pay for her son’s Korean school fee. This money will enable her son to go work in Korea. In the future, she would like expand her business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to pay her son's  Korean school fee

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn is 54 years old.  She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been selling groceries for more than four years, earning approximately $1 daily. 

Three of her children are employed in a garment factory.  They earn about $12 each day.  Due to a lack of fund, Saroeurn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a plot of land.  This purchase will help her obtain enough space for her children. 

In the future, Saroeurn would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Yohou

texts.en:
Yohou is 43 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running a tailoring shop for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $5 each day.  Because the motorbike is old, Yohou is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband. 

This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income for her family.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's taxi service.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met is 63 years old. She is married and resides with her daughter in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a chef in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $3 each day. Her daughter is a garment worker. She earns about $4 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Met is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to make more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house

loans.name: Onn

texts.en:
Onn is 45 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. One of her children is a stove-maker, who earns about USD 5 daily. 

Due to a lack of funds, Onn is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase zinc and timber, to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. 

In the future, she would like to run tailoring shop at home and help her youngest child earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and timber, to build a new house.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat is 40 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making brooms to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $13 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sophat is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses and help her children get to work on time. In the future, she would like to expand her business and fix her house’s wall.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met is 56 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, they have been involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years. They earn approximately 2 USD per day. Three of her children are employed in garment factories. They earn about 12 USD each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Met is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell. This purchase will help her earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and rebuild her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch is 44 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 per day. Two of her children are garment workers who make an income of $10 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Touch is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce their transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her youngest child earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Channoeun

texts.en:
Channoeun is 25 years old. He is married and lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman who earns about $10, daily. His wife sells palm juice. She earns about $3 each day.

Due to the difficulty in his family’s transportation, Channoeun is requesting a loan of $1300. He will use it to purchase a motorbike, for commuting to work. This purchase will help him to reduce the family's transportation expenses. In the future he would like to ask for another loan, to expand his wife's business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike, for commuting to work

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin is 49 years old. She is married and resides with her six children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

Chhin has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 daily. 

To improve her farming business, Chhin is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy cattle to use in tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce her tilling expenses. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use in tilling her farmland

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is a 64 year old married woman with 13 children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living and she has been doing this for many years. 

Emi has requested this loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, weed sprayer, gloves, and a rake. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Emi hopes to develop her business to exceed her expectations.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, weed sprayer, gloves and a rake

loans.name: Saumama

texts.en:
Saumama is 35 years old and single with 1 child. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 6 years. 

Saumama has requested a loan to buy wooden carved designs, paint and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy wooden carved designs, paint, and material

loans.name: Paepaepuna

texts.en:
Paepae is 21 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells elei printed materials to earn a living and has been doing this for 5 years.

Paepae has requested a loan to buy fabric, color paint, brushes, stencils and elei carved board. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric, color paint, brushes, stencils and elei carved board

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 43-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She has had a lawnmower business for 6 years. 

Sina needs a loan to buy a lawnmower, oil, fuel, trimmer line and a new pull cord. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. Sina joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a lawnmower, oil, fuel, trimmer line and a new pull cord

loans.name: Iuogafa

texts.en: Iuogafa is a 35-year-old woman who is separated from her husband with six children. She runs a business selling food in a stall in her community. She has many years of experience in this business. Iuogafa has requested a loan to buy sugar, salts, flour, soft drinks, snacks and chicken. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salts, flour, soft drinks, snacks and chicken.

loans.name: Anoanoai

texts.en:
Anoanoai is 47-year-old woman that is separated from her husband but is staying with four children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows taro and other crops that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Anoanoai needs a loan to buy fertilizer, weed killer, a shovel, a mist blower, a bush knife, and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Anoanoai will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, a shovel, a mist blower, a bush knife, and gloves.

loans.name: Taumuli

texts.en: Taumuli is 51 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing. She has many years of experience in this line of business. Taumuli needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, fabric materials, needles and thread. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric materials, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Veroniko

texts.en:
Veronika is a 17-year-old woman who is married with one child. She runs a business selling food in a stall in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Veronika has requested a loan to buy rice, salt, onion, chicken, snacks, and soft drinks. 

She plans to use her profits to support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, onion, chicken, snacks, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sua

texts.en:
Sua is a 48-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells chips in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Sua needs a loan to buy cooking oil, a new oven, a large cooking pot, salts, taro, and bananas. 

She plans to use her profits to support her family. Sua has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a new oven, a large cooking pot, salts, taro, and bananas.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 47 years old and married with nine children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing. She has many years of experience in this line of business. 

Telesia needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, fabric materials, needles, and thread. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric materials, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is a salesman; he is 31 years old, single and lives with his grandparents in Absheron region.  He is engaged to Sona.

Tural has a small shoe store. He has been in this business for five years.
 
Tural applied for a loan of 800 AZN to buy new shoes for the winter season.  He wants to earn more money to improve his stand of living.

He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for help.  Tural wants to have a lovely family and to open a big shoe store in the future.

loans.use: to buy new shoes to sell for the winter season.

loans.name: Vurgun

texts.en:
Vurgun is married with two children. He is 42 years old. His wife is a teacher at school. Vurgun is from Masalli city and now lives in the Abseron region with his family. Vurgun’s son studies at Technical University at second course, and his daughter goes to 11th class.

He sells building materials, such as cement, gypsum, building tools, etc. in his store. Today, he needs 800 AZN. For this reason, he applied to Komak organization. He wants to buy several types of products, such as parquet, wallpaper, etc.

Vurgun is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the aid in growing his business. In the future, he wants to increase the area of his store.

loans.use: to buy several types of products like parquet, wallpaper, etc.

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en:
Fikrat is 51 years old and has been married since he was 25.  Fikrat and his family are from the Mahmudlu village of Fuzuli city and now live in Absheron.  Already 20 years have passed since Fikrat and his family had become IDP (internally displaced peoples) from their native land of Fuzuli.

Fikrat’s wife is a barber.  His daughter was married 2 years ago.  Fikrat’s elder son was married this year and works as a cashier at a market, and his youngest son is enrolled in his third year at school.

Fikrat is a taxi driver.  Winter is coming and he needs 500 AZN to buy a new wheel, and tire chains.  For this reason he is requesting a loan from the Komak organization.

For this loan he is thankful to Komak and Kiva. In the future he wants to change his car.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel, and tire chains.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is married. She lives in the Abseron region with four members of her family. They have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Agdam city for 20 years. Bahar’s husband is a butcher; her daughter Nigar and son Agali are married. 

Bahar has been engaged in a tailoring business for two years. She sews skirts, blouses, dresses and curtains. She periodically receives orders from her  customers and prepares the orders.

Today, she is planning to increase her working capital to buy new material. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,600 AZN [Azerbaijani New Manat].

She is thankful to Kiva and the Komak organization for a loan. In the future, she wants to open a curtain store.

loans.use: to buy new material.

loans.name: Odonjamaa

texts.en:
Mr. Odonjamaa, 57 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on plot of land. 

Odonjamaa has been rendering transportation service to local people since 1990. His wife has the profession of tailor and works at a cashmere factory. Their daughter studies at a medical college. 

Odonjamaa is requesting a loan of MNT 4,000,000 to pay for his daughter's tuition fee. He thinks the best thing he can do for his daughter is to invest in her education, which will later help her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nansalmaa, 56 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. She has been renting out hostel rooms to students from rural areas since 2009. Her daughter stays at home looking after her granddaughter. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate her old house. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating as well as less pollutants are released into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam, in order to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Saruultuya

texts.en: Mrs. Saruultuya, 53 years old, lives with her sister, son-in-law and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her husband and daughter both work in Korea on employment contract between Mongolia and Korea. Saruultuya has been selling shoes to local people by renting a stall at a trade center since 2011. Before this business, she has worked in a mining company and retired from that work two years ago. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy shoes in a large quantity at wholesale prices. As a result, she will continue to sell shoes to local people without worrying about inventory shortages.

loans.use: A loan of $2400 helps Saruultuya to buy shoes in large quantity.

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en: Mr. Bayanmunkh, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for two years. His wife works as a saleswoman at a trade center. Their sons both go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts in order to upgrade his car. After the upgrade, he can render taxi service without worrying about his customers' safety.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Otgontsagaan

texts.en:
Mr. Otgontsagaan, who is 39 years old, lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2009. 

The house he lives in has badly insulated floors, and during winter time, it gets cold from the bottom. So he is requesting a loan of MNT 500,000 to buy a low-pressure heater. 

Installing the heater will ensure a warm environment for him, and he will enthusiastically work.

loans.use: to buy a low-pressure heater

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Mr. Otgonjargal, 25 years old, lives with his pregnant wife in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been working at a tailoring factory. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy furniture such as a sofa, closet and drawers for home convenience. A comfortable and warm place is necessary for his pregnant wife. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his wife.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Ganbagana

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbagana, 32 years old, lives with his wife and son in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. 

Ganbagana has been working as an operator at a mining company since 2011. Before this job, he had rendered taxi services for a living. His wife makes and sells Mongolian traditional dresses to local people. Their son goes to primary school. 

Ganbagana is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000 to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam in order to renovate his old house. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya, 53 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a senior teller at a bank for eleven years; her husband is a sentry at a high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate her house. 

As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air. The house renovation is necessary as the Mongolian winter is infamous for its coldness.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Unenkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Unenkhuu, 32 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. 

He has been transporting goods between districts since 2010, and also rents out some unused rooms to students who come from the rural area to study in Ulaanbaatar. His wife sells shoes to local people. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to renovate his house. 

After the renovation, his family and his customers will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Darkhantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Darkhantsetseg, 31 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old brick house on fenced land. She has been selling shoes to local people, renting stall at a trade center, since 2010. Her husband is a serviceman at a steel mill. Their elder two children go to primary school and the youngest one is in kindergarten. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate her house which has never been renovated. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Ulaanbaatar, according to state research.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Choijil

texts.en:
Choijil, 27 years old, lives with his wife and child in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on fenced land. Choijil has been providing taxi service to local people since 2008 and, in addition to this income source, he also raises livestock on his land. His wife is an obstetrician and currently stays at home taking care of their child. 

Choijil is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy a car that runs on natural gas. The advantage of a natural gas car is that it contributes to cleaner air because it emits less pollution and it wastes less fuel per distance traveled. The borrower's current car has deteriorated over the years and is out of service, so a new car is needed for his taxi service, which is the family's main income source.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas car

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg, 29 years old, lives with her parents in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at a hotel since 2007. Her mother is a cook at a catering company. 

The house her family lives in has deteriorated over the years so Ganchimeg is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for her house renovation. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollution is released into the air. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution according to the state research department.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for her house renovation

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en:
Dashdorj, 36 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been sewing clothes on her own since 2006 for a living. Her husband provides taxi services to local people. Their elder three children go to high school while the youngest one is educated at kindergarten. 

Dashdorj is requesting a loan of 2,750,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in the cities because it produces no harmful pollution from the tailpipe, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The car will be used by her husband for taxi service as his current car emits too much carbon dioxide.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Bayarsaikhan is 50 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. He heads the department of supply at the military base. His wife sews clothes on her own and her daughter studies at university. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some repair. So, Bayarsaikhan is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned so fewer pollutants are released into air. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass

loans.name: Khurmankhan

texts.en: Mr. Khurmankhan, 51 years old, lives with his wife and son in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. He has been working as a technician at a copper mine since 1997. His wife has a disability and gets a state pension. His son works as a barber at a beauty salon. He is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The car will be used for transportation, as his wife needs constant travel to the hospital due to her disability.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Delgertsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Delgertsetseg, 44 years old, lives with her two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a cafeteria near a bus station since 2011. Her elder son just graduated from university and is currently seeking a job. Her younger son goes to high school. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to open another cafeteria near a train station. The loan will be used to purchase equipment and pay rent fees. By opening another cafeteria, her family income will increase. She is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for her sons.

loans.use: to open a second cafeteria

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en:
Mrs. Selenge, 36 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been teaching mathematics at high school since 2005. Her husband is head of a trade union at a particular university. They live in a large house on fenced land and they rent some rooms to students who came from rural areas. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, her family and renters will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Dorjpurev

texts.en: Mr. Dorjpurev, 40 years old, lives with his wife and three children in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2011. His wife currently stays at home looking after their children. Before the transportation business, he and his wife have been working as driver and conductor respectively at a bus company. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Tugriks (MNT) to buy coal in bulk in order to sell later at a higher price to local people. As a result, his family's income will increase and then he can afford to pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy coal in bulk

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en: Mrs. Ayush, 40 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been making dresses to order for her clients for over nine years and works in her own workshop. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their two children both go to high school. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy an electric sewing machine which will increase her efficiency. Her current sewing machine has become dull and can't sew some materials.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Namnan-Ochir

texts.en: Mr. Namnan-Ochir, 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2008. His wife has a position of insurance sales representative at an insurance company. He is requesting a loan of 2,700,000 MNT to buy planks in order to save money. Now it is wintertime and the price of planks has reached its bottom. These planks will be stored as winter comes to Mongolia.

loans.use: to buy planks in a large amount

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Gerelmaa, 29 years old, lives with her husband and child in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling clothes to local people at a trade center. Her husband is a driver at a financial institution. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The car will be for personal use.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Purevsuren, 55 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a brick house on a plot of land. He has been transporting people between districts, using his own minivan, since 2004. His wife works as the conductor, on his minivan. Using his previous loan, he has repaired his minivan and generated enough income for his son to study in Korea.

Now, he is requesting a loan of 2,600,000 MNT. He will use the loan to buy building and insulation materials for house renovation, such as shingles, fiberglass, bricks, foam and windows. After the renovation, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned. Then, fewer pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials for energy-efficient home renovation

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarantuya, 50 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as chief cook at a military base for 11 years. Her husband has been working in masonry, plumbing, and welding. 

Using her previous loan, Sarantuya renovated her house by buying building and insulation materials. Now she is requesting a loan of MNT 7,500,000 to make an extension to her house. The extension will reduce heat loss and then she will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to make an extension to her house.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en: Ankhbayar, 27 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Using his previous loan, he renovated his old house. Now he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to make an extension on his house, because his house is too small and does not provide enough space for his children to play. Also the extension will reduce overall heat loss and thereby reduce coal usage for heating. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Ulaanbaatar according to state research.

loans.use: to make an extension on his house

loans.name: Namuun

texts.en:
Mrs. Namuun, 46 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

Namuun has been sewing clothes at a trade center since 2001. Her husband is the driver of a truck and works at a mining company. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 7,600,000 to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollutants through the tailpipe and it also wastes less fuel. The car will be used by her son for a taxi service, as an additional income source.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.en:
Mathilde lives with her husband and their two children in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. She has run her clothing sales business for  five years, having started it with her own capital. Her latest loan was invested in the business.

This is Mathilde's ninth loan which she will use to start building her house. She will buy concrete blocks and cement to raise some or part of her house walls. She will invest all this loan in this construction because she wants to keep building it with her business profits. The other construction materials she will buy are rods, sand, gravel, etc. She has a wood structure home and she wants to build it with a safer structure like concrete blocks and cement.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in repaying their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their businesses and attending their group meetings. Mathilde thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, thanks to you for your support!

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement, rods, sand, etc

loans.name: Orxan

texts.en:
Orxan is a 22 year-old, young, married client with one child. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last four years. During these years Orxan gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every meal of an Azerbaijan family and are also used in fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Orxan wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN, . With the loan he will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en: Tural is 20-year-old single man. Tural is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his parents in the Agdash IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 2 years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his father. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Tural ’s income from business is 80 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of his parents, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He needs a loan of 800 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Hidayat

texts.en:
Hidayat is a 53-year-old married man. Hidayat is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Agdash IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers, and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family.

Hidayat’s income from this business is 130 AZN for monthly. In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his son will help him grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. 

He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1,500 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenues in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 5 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is one of the members of El Gran Esfuerzo (The Big Effort) 5 group, which is located in the town of Hato Mayor. The town's economy depends on farming, and it is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. The group's main business activity is selling clothes, and most of the members who make up this group are Haitian immigrants.

Rosa has two children, and they live together with her father. She tells that her greatest challenge now is to have her own house. She loves going to church and to work. Rosa is very excited to be receiving her 13th loan from Esperanza International after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loans, and thereby given a step forward in the growth of her business. She has had her business for almost 12 years. She set up her business with a small amount of savings that she was keeping for business purposes. She started growing it with her first loan from Esperanza. 

Rosa is planning to invest her new loan in buying clothes, especially for the coming Christmas season. She plans to use her profits to buy things she needs and start building her house.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell, especially for the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.name: Yalcin

texts.en:
Yalcin is 41 years old. Together with his wife, he is raising three children. His wife stays at home.

Yalcin is selling toys for kids. He has 12 years' experience in this business. This is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income from this business is AZN 120. 

But it is not enough funds to solve his family's problems.  For that Yalcin needs a loan of AZN 2,000 to increase his stocks of toys and perfumes with newly released items and special offers that he is sure will help better him serve his customers and give them special discounts. 

He has a good loan history, and this is his third loan.

loans.use: to increase his stocks of toys and perfumes

loans.name: Serafet

texts.en:
Serafet is a 59-year-old married woman. She has six beautiful kids and works as a merchant selling household goods for the home. She is a very hardworking woman, working all day and also taking care of her family. 

Serafet has been selling household goods for ten years. Her neighbors were her first clients, and day by day she expanded her business and opened a large market. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy more household goods because people often ask her for products she doesn't have. 

This her first loan, and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more household goods.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid is 56 years old. He has a small business selling clothing out of his home. He sells women's clothes. He buys the clothing from another city during weekly trips. He said that he started this business with money that he had earned from previous jobs. Month by month he is growing his business with this hard-earned money. This activity generates sufficient income and there is strong demand for his clothing as he has a lot of customers every day. In order to satisfy customer demand and expand his business, Vahid needs a loan of 2000 AZN. This will let him continue with his sales and improve his income. He has a good client history and this is his second loan.

loans.use: to satisfy customer demand and expand his business

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en:
Nicat is a 32-year-old, young, married client from Agjabadi. He and his wife are raising 2 children together. His wife stays at home. Nicat's parents stay with him, too. Nicat is a worker who repairs cars. He has been in this field since his childhood, and he established his own business in 2005. He has good experience in this field and employs two people. He is well-known in the neighborhood, thanks to his affordable prices. He is a very talented person.

Nicat is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to buy modern tools for his shop. He believes that this loan will help him to work overtime in order to provide for all of the needs of his family. He has a good loan history, and this is his second loan.

loans.use: to buy modern tools for his shop.

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en:
Nicat is a 20 years old. He does not have higher education but is a very talented young man. Neither of his parents are able to work because they are both ill. Nicat is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables from his spot in a central bazaar and from his home. He has a year of experience in his field, knows his customers' needs, and has reliable providers.

Nicat chose this business because it is profitable and brings a stable income. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and are made into fresh punch. 

With a monthly income of 120 AZN, Nicat wants to repair his market stall but does not have enough funds. For that he needs a loan of 1000 AZN. This is the first loan he is receiving through Aqroinvest. He hasn't gotten loans from state banks, but Agroinvest gave him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair his market stand.

loans.name: Ebenezer La Rue Group

texts.fr:
Viergena est la coordonatrice de son groupe Ebenezer La Rue. Elle habite dans la région de Ouanaminthe d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle est marie et elle a deux enfants. 

Viergena a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 7 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans achete produits divers, que des vêtements, des cosmétiques, des chaussures. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour faire du commerce comme vendre des produits alimentaires, charbon et des produits cosmetique. Viergena dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce et ayant une entreprise prospère.
texts.en:
Viergena is the coordinator of Ebenezer La Rue group. She lives in the Ouanaminthe region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is ver limited. She is married and has two children.

Viergena has been managing a business selling diverse products for the past seven years. She would like to use this loan to purchase additional diverse merchandise such as clothes, cosmetics and shoes. Other members of the group need the loan in order to buy and sell other food products, coal and cosmetics. Viergena says that her dream is to increase her business and build a prosperous company.

loans.use: purchase diverse products such as shoes, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsgee, 35 years old, lives with her husband, son and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling casual clothes to local people by renting a stall at a trade center. Her husband is currently unemployed and stays at home. Her mother has a position as a bookkeeper at a hotel. 

Before the clothes sales business, she and her husband had worked in Korea on an employment contract. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to buy clothes in large quantity so that she can run her clothes sales business without worrying about inventory shortage. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothes in large quantity.

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuluuntsetseg, 45, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She sews clothes and has rented a stall at a trade center since 2007. Next to her stall, her husband runs his goldsmith workshop. Both of their children study at a university. 

Chuluuntsetseg is requesting a loan of 7,600,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities. The car will be used for transportation.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for personal use.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbayar, 45 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the easternmost town in Mongolia. He has been working as a serviceman since 2008 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. His wife works at a health institution. He is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows. After installing those windows, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to purchase and install vacuum insulated windows in his house

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Uranchimeg, 42 years old, lives with her son in Kherlen, easternmost town of Mongolia. She began cobbling shoes eight months ago. Her son is a cook, and works at a private firm. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 MNT to buy a low pressure heater in order overcome the harsh winter climate. Using the heater is beneficial in some way than burning coal for heating, which is costly for the family economy and harmful for the environment.

loans.use: to buy a low pressure heater.

loans.name: Tamir

texts.en: Mr. Tamir, 45 years old, lives with her younger son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been working as a barkeeper at a local pub since 2003. Her elder son works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, and sometimes transfers money to her. Her younger son studies at a local high school. She is requesting a loan for 4,500,000 MNT to buy a building she plans to live in, and insulation materials such as the bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam she needs to renovate her house. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable, warm place where they burn less coal for heating and release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy a home and insulation materials to make it warm and comfortable.

loans.name: The Help Sisters Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from members of the "The Help Sisters" group based in Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. Members of The Help Sisters are very pleased to inform you that the loan they received from you has been very helpful in boosting their respective businesses, both in size and quality.

Having repaid their last Kiva loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of 1,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. With the help of this new loan, they will buy more inventories to add to their current stock. Musu, who continues to serve as their featured leader, will again use her share of the loan to buy more clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
Shola is 51 years old. She has four children who study at secondary school in different grades. Shola is an IDP (internally displaced person), and she lives in the Sabirabad region with her family. She is a Lacin refugee. Shola is a housewife and farmer. All of her children help out with the farming, supporting their parents by carrying out various daily activities like cleaning, spreading fertilizer, applying liquid plant food, etc. 

Shola completed a primary level of education, thanks to the efforts that her parents made when she was young. She is a very family-oriented, hardworking, and humble woman. She works to take care of her children and husband, supporting them every day by preparing their meals, etc. Her dreams are to support her children in their studies, and to see them graduate from university. She hopes to give them a better quality and style of life. Shola is therefore requesting a loan of 1200 AZN to purchase supplies like fertilizers, liquid plant food, etc. to maintain her fruit crops. This will allow her to have an excellent harvest and to then successfully sell her products at the market.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for fruit crops, such as fertilizers, liquid plant food, etc.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 35 years old and married with two sons.  He is an IDP person, living with his family in the Sabirabad region. 

Ramil started a business selling food products in 2006. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foods as well as detergents, like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream, and washing powder, as well as many other foodstuffs in his store. 

Ramil is not alone in this business. His wife actively helps him with sales. His monthly profit isAZN 200, and he is on the way to increasing it. His business is very successful because of a good location in the central Sabirabad bazaar. 

Today, Ramil is requesting a loan of AZN 1,000 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. 

Ramil has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to increase his stock of grocery products

loans.name: Farac

texts.en:
Farac is 43 years old and married, with two  children.  He is an IDP person, and he is living in the Sabirabad region with his family. 

He was unemployed for several years, so to improve his situation, he started a farming business 12 years ago. Now this is the main source of income for his family. 

Raising and selling fresh fruits and vegetables brings a stable income and is in high demand among the Azerbaijani people. Fresh vegetables are good for national dishes like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are favorites for punch. Farac usually sells his crops in the central bazaar, and his profit per month is AZN 180. 

Farac decided to expand his business. For this purpose, he has applied for a AZN 2,000 loan. He will buy seeds and fertilizer to increase his crops and cover his customers' demand. 

This is Farac's fourth loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to  buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alim

texts.en:
Alim is a 28-year-old, young married client from Sabirabad region. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last four years. During these years, Alim gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in an Azerbaijan family and also are used in fresh punch. 

Alim usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. As these products are in high demand, Alim wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This is going to be his second loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Hesen

texts.en:
Hesen is a 53-year-old married man. Together with his wife, he is raising 2 kids. Hesen is an IDP person, and he is living in the Sabirabad region. For 25   years, he has worked in his own business, a bakery and cafeteria. He started his business selling a small quantity of products, and then he increased his merchandise slowly. 

Hesen is planning to expand his business by buying a larger quantity of items in order to increase his profits and income to start supporting his family financially. He doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for a loan 2,000 AZN. This is going to be his first loan.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying a larger quantity of items.

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en:
Adalat is a 44-year-old married man with three children. He has been breeding livestock from a very young age thanks to his father, who taught him well. He already has 10 years of experience. During these years, Adalat has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

He purchases calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profitable price in a livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes, such as Pilau and Dolma.

His business requires a lot of physical strength as Adalat spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him feed the animals.

His monthly income is 150 AZN, and Adalat wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put in his business to cover the market. For this purpose, he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will use the loan to buy two cattle, one dairy cow, and a fodder. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, one dairy cow, and a fodder.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid is 43 years old and a married man with two children. He is a market vendor, and sells different kinds of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. He has 20 years of experience, and has a deep knowledge of the market and the demands of his clients.

This year, he decided to start his own second business. Now, he is a farmer and is raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. 

Vahid needs a loan 500 AZN to buy different fruit trees. He hopes that only Kiva will help him .

loans.use: to buy different fruit trees.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is a 22-year-old student at Tefekkur University. Elvin studied well in high school and hopes that he can also successfully graduate from university and become a good specialist. He is planning to work in his field after graduation to start helping his parents financially. 

His parents are currently facing a financial crisis, which does not allow them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for a loan 2,000 AZN. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Perviz

texts.en:
Perviz is a 21-year-old student at Tefekkur University.  Perviz’s father is an employee in the public sector, and his is the only source of income for the family. His father can't pay the university installments for his son because of high family expenses, so Perviz needs a loan 2,000 AZN.

This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester so he can complete his studies. This will insure him a better life in the future.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: We Are Here Group

texts.en: Greetings are coming to you from Mariama and her fellow group members. On behalf of the group, Mariama is very pleased to inform you that the Kiva loan has been very helpful in developing their respective businesses and in improving their economic well-being. Mariama is able to educate her children out of the profits she makes from her daily sales. However, she would like to further improve her business by buying more clothes to add to her current stock. She and her group mates have therefore applied for a new loan of 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones each in order to further expand their business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the "Tamaraneh" group for the second time. Having finished repaying their last Kiva loan very successfully, they are requesting a new loan of 3,300,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With the help of this new loan, they will be able to further add more inventory to their respective businesses.

 Adama remains the featured leader of this group. She is again going to use her share of the loan to buy bales of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Firuzakhon

texts.ru: Фирузахон 23-летняя молодая женщина. Она живет с родными в селе района Хуросон. Фирузахон работает в дехканском хозяйстве и одновременно занимается животноводством. Она замужем и у нее есть сын. В купле-продаже скота ей помогает муж, а за скотом она ухаживает сама. Фирузахон сейчас имеет одну дойную корову, которая обеспечивает ее годовалого ребенка молоком. Фирузахон хочет купить еще несколько коров, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота в своем скотном дворе. Чтобы совершить данную покупку она просит кредит. Фирузахон надеется, что ей помогут, и она купит коров.
texts.en: Firuzakhon is a young woman, 23 years old. She lives with her family in a village in Khuroson. Firuzakhon works in an orchard and raises livestock. She is married and has a son. Her husband helps her buy and sell livestock, and she takes care of the cattle herself. Firuzakhon now has a dairy cow that provides milk for her one-year-old child. Firuzakhon wants to buy a few more cows to so she will have more livestock in her barnyard. She is asking for a loan to make this purchase. Firuzakhon hopes that you will help her so she can buy a cow.

loans.use: buy cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Abduqodir

texts.ru:
Абдукодир военнослужащий в отставке. Он 20 лет служил во благо своей Родины. Абдукодир вышел на пенсию с высоко поднятой головой со званием полковника. Сейчас ему 60 лет. Он отец пятерых детей и дед. Он со своей большой семьей живет в районе Хамадони.  
   Абдукодир на данный момент нигде не работает. Он решил начать свой бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Сейчас он строит коровник, чтобы его будущие животные не мерзли зимой. Чтобы приобрести нужное количество скота для бизнеса, нужна определенная сумма. У Абдукодира нет достаточного капитала, чтобы совершить такую покупку. Поэтому он просит кредит. Помогите Абдукодиру начать бизнес!
texts.en:
Abduqodir is a retired veteran. He served his country for 20 years. Abduqodir retired at the rank of colonel, with his head held high. Now he is 60 years old. He is the father of five children and is a grandfather. He lives with his large family in the region of Hamadoni.

Abduqodir currently doesn't work. He decided to start his own business buying and selling cattle. He is currently building a barn so that his future animals won't feel cold in the winter. To acquire the right amount of livestock for his business, he needs a certain amount of money. Abduqodir doesn't have sufficient capital to accomplish such a purchase. For that reason, he is applying for a loan. Please help Abduqodir start his business!

loans.use: To start an animal production business and to purchase cattle

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred  is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the  region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with three of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Fred  has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Fred  has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his stock, and will help Fred  to generate greater profits and create employment opportunities for the family members. Fred  hopes that in the future he will be able to have a sustainable business. 

Fred  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Милая женщина в красно-желтом платье это Хосият, ей 59 лет. А рядом с ней ее дочь Сарвиноз. Сарвиноз разведена, и с тремя детьми живет у Хосият. Сарвиноз недолго работала в школе уборщицей из-за того что у нее нет паспорта и ее официально не приняли на работу. Сарвиноз умеет шить и хочет развиваться в этом плане. Тогда она сможет брать заказы для шитья. Из-за отсутствия паспорта и других документов Сарвиноз не может получить кредит, поэтому ее мама Хосият берет кредит, чтобы купить дочери швейную машинку. У Хосият не хватает средств для такой покупки. Она пенсионерка и тоже не работает. Поэтому для их семьи этот кредит очень важен. Помогите им!
texts.en: The lovely woman in the red and yellow dress is Khosiyat.  She is 59 years old. Next to her is her daughter Sarvinoz. Sarvinoz is divorced, has three children and lives with Khosiyat. Sarvinoz briefly worked as a janitor at the school because she had no passport and was not officially hired. Sarvinoz knows how to sew and wants to become better at this craft. Then, she would be able to take sewing orders. Because she does not have a passport and other documents, Sarvinoz cannot obtain a loan, so her mom Khosiyat has requested a loan to buy her daughter a sewing machine. Khosiyat does not have the means to make such a purchase. She is retired and does not work. Because of this, the loan is very important to their families. Help them!

loans.use: to obtain a sewing machine for her daughter

loans.name: Gulchera

texts.ru: Гулчере 43 года. Она начинающая предпринимательница. Гулчера планирует начать свой бизнес по купле и продаже скотов. Она вперед продумала свой бизнес план. Единственным ограничением для нее это нехватка средств. Гулчера запаслась сеном на зиму и построила кров для скотов. И теперь она решила реализовать свои идеи с помощью кредита. Тогда она обеспечится своим бизнесом и хорошим доходом. Она не боится получить огромный объем работы, ведь ей всегда поможет ее муж и сын. Муж Гулчеры работает водителем грузовой машины. Другой сын работает заграницей. У Гулчеры есть 3 дочери. Они будут очень рады, если у их мамы будет бизнес, и они ей помогут. Сумму кредита она потратит для закупа скотов. Для начала малое количество, но в будущем надеется на расширение своей деятельности.
texts.en: Gulchera is 43 years old. She is starting out as an entrepreneur. Gulchera plans to start a business buying and selling cattle. She has planned out her business plan in advance. Her only restriction is the lack of funds. Gulchera has stocked hay for the winter and built a shelter for cattle. Now, she has decided to realize her ideas with the help of a loan. Then she will be provided with a good business and a good income. She is not afraid to do a large amount of work, because she can always get help from her husband and son. Her husband works as a cargo truck driver. Another son is working abroad. Gulchera has 3 daughters. They will be very happy if their mother has a business, and they would help her. She will use the loan to purchase cattle. She will start with a small amount, but hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to start a business

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru: Зокирчону 25 лет. Он холост. У Зокирчона не полное высшее образование. Он не нашел работу в своем селе Хамадони, поэтому решился на создании своего бизнеса. Зокирчон хочет заняться животноводством. Для такого бизнеса у него имеются все условия - имеет коровник, сено и другие  виды корма, благоприятный и чистый воздух Таджикистана. Только у Зокирчона не хватает начального капитала для создания бизнеса. Он просит помочь закупить несколько голов крупнорогатого скота, чтобы они стали основоположниками в его бизнес. Зокирчон надеется на успех своего нового бизнеса!
texts.en: Zokirjon is 25 years old. He is single.  Zokirjon did not complete a higher education. He did not find work in his village Hamadon, and so decided to create his own business. Zokirjon wants to raise livestock. He has all the necessary conditions for this business - a barn, hay and other feed, and the pleasant and clean air of Tajikistan. The only thing he lacks is start-up capitol to create a business. He has asked for help to buy a few heads of cattle, so that they become the foundation of his business. Zokirjon hopes his new business will be successful!

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to start a livestock business

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru: Собир заботливый семейный человек. Ему 39 лет. У него три сына и две дочери, которым с 4 по 14 лет. Его жена не работает, она ухаживает за детьми и домом. Собир как глава семьи сам обеспечивает семью. Он подзарабатывает мастером, предоставляющим услуги по ремонту квартир. Это сезонная работа и с наступлением холодов у него совсем не бывает заказов и его семья остается без источника дохода. Собир долго планировал и наконец решился начать новый бизнес. Его всегда интересовало животноводство. Ведь это прибыльный бизнес и не требует больших усилий. Собир во дворе дома построил сарай для содержания скота и запасся сеном и кормом для скота. Теперь, чтобы приобрести сам скот, ему не хватает финансовых средств и поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Собир на сумму от кредита хочет закупить молодых бычков и телят, и начать свой бизнес по откорму и продаже скота. Он ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Sobir is a caring family man. He is 39 years old. He has three sons and two daughters who are aged from four to 14. His wife does not work; she looks after the children and the home. Sobir as head of the family supports the family on his own. He works part-time as an artisan, offering services in apartment repair. This is seasonal work and with the onset of cold weather he will have nearly no orders and his family is left without a source of income. Sobir planned for a long time and finally decided to start a new business. He was always interested in raising livestock. After all, this is a lucrative business and does not require much effort. In the yard of his home, Sobir has built a shed for keeping cattle and stocked it with hay and cattle feed. Now, in order to purchase himself cattle, he does not have the financial means and therefore he requested a loan. With the sum of the loan, Sobir wants to buy young bulls and calves, and to start his own business fattening and selling cattle. He is awaiting support.

loans.use: A loan of $1,050 helps Sobir to buy young bulls and calves in order to start a business in fattening and selling cattle.

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Даврону 43 года. Он женат. У него есть 2 детей. Они все вместе живут в городе Худжанд. Там же Даврон работает. Он работает мастером отдельщиком. Он делает ремонты в квартирах и в домах по заказу. В соответствии того что зимой очень холодно, жители ремонтируют дома только летом. У Даврона сезонная работа, поэтому зимой у него отсутствует доход. Он хочет взять в аренду маленькое помещение и там предоставлять жителям Худжанда услуги по прошивке мобильных телефонов. Прошивка для мобильников нужна для восстановления программ на телефоне и защита от вирусов. Такой процесс проводится с помощью компьютеров или ноутбуков. Поэтому он просит кредит, чтобы приобрести ноутбук.
texts.en: Davron is 43 years old. He is married. He has two children. They all live in the city of Khujand. This is also where Davron works. He works as a master finisher. He does repairs in apartments and homes on order. Because of the fact that winter is very cold, people repair their homes only in the summer. Davron has seasonal work, therefore in winter he has no income. He wants to rent a small room and there to offer residents of Khujand services for mobile phone firmware. Firmware for mobile phones is needed to restore the programs on the phone and virus protection. This process is carried out with the help of a computer or laptop. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to acquire a laptop.

loans.use: A loan of $650 helps Davron to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Bankoama Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Bankoama” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. 

They are requesting  a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each member of the group in order to further expand their respective businesses. 

The featured leader of this group is Kumba.  Kumba is 37 years old; she was born in Gbane, a village in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a trader, and the couple has eight children, who are attending primary and secondary school. 

Kumba has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells rice, flour, palm oil, pepper, salt, etc. Kumba has requested this loan in order to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, palm oil, pepper, salt, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Эту 22-летнюю молодую женщину зовут Манзура. Она замужем за Дилшода и проживает с ним и его семьей в районе Шахритус. У них пока нет детей. Манзура работает на половину дня в местной школе учительницей. Сейчас она хочет дополнительно открыть собственный бизнес. Ее интересует сфера торговли. Манзура уже приобрела точку продажи на рынке и хочет заняться продажей фруктов. На этот шаг ее подтолкнуло стремление улучшить качество жизни. Ведь торговый бизнес считается прибыльным бизнесом, приносящим ежедневную выручку. Манзура запрашивает в кредит 950 долларов США, чтобы закупить сезонные фрукты, в частности гранат, яблоки, виноград, бананы и другие и начать торговлю. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en: This 22-year-old young woman is named Manzura  She is married to Dilshoda, and lives with him and his family in the Shahrituz region. They do not yet have children. Manzura works for a half-day in a local school as a teacher. Now, she wants additionally to open her own business. She is interested in the trade sphere. Manzura has already purchased a point of sale and wants to engage in selling fruits. This step pushed her drive to improve her quality of life. Since trade is a profitable business, generating a daily profit. Manzura is requesting a loan of US$950, in order to buy seasonal fruits, in particular pomegranates, apples, grapes, bananas, and others, and to start trading.

loans.use: A loan of $950 helps Manzura to buy seasonal fruits to start a trade business.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sagrado Corazon está en su 4to ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, además ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, con el cual quieren saber la situación en la que cada una se encuentra y así poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ada, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir está en un nivel medio de ingresos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y con ese trabajo está ayudando a su familia, está generando los ingresos para poder luchar día a día y así tratar de que no les falte nada. Quiere seguir creciendo y es por eso que se está esforzando al máximo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas de verano y así seguir luchando y esforzándose por su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The "Sagrado Corazón" ("Sacred Heart") group is in its fourth cycle of the women's committee program. They form part of the poverty elimination program with which they want to know the current situation of each member and work together in this way.

One of the members is Ada who showed a poverty level of two in her survey, meaning that she is within the average income level. She makes a living selling clothing. With this work she is supporting her family and generating an income to fight each day and make sure that they do not go without. She wants to continue expanding and it is for this reason that she is working as hard as she can. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of summer clothing in order to continue fighting for her family. She is thankful for this opportunity because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of summer clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 45 años, está casada con CHincc y tiene dos hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha a base de material noble. Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura y es una labor que desempeña hace más de 25 años, se inicio con ayuda de su esposo logrando adquirir hasta hoy 3 hectáreas de terrenos donde posee plantaciones de cacao y barbasco. Al empezar con este oficio de manera independiente logró aprovechar su juventud para trabajar de manera abnegada y lograr hasta hoy mantener sus cultivos en muy buen estado permitiéndole obtener almendras de cacao con calidad de exportación. Para desempeñar una campaña productiva debe necesariamente contar con capital para la compra de insumos tales como abono orgánico, herramientas y pago a los trabajadores que le apoyan en las distintas labores. Uno de sus principales objetivos es seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza para comprar un terreno de 1 hectárea y ampliar su producción de cacao para mejorar sus ingresos a largo plazo. Este es su segundo préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y se siente muy agradecida por la confianza y oportunidad que le brindan. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 45, is married to Chincc and has two children who live with her in her house made of quality materials.

Elizabeth has made a living in agriculture for more than 25 years.  She started with the help of her husband and at present has managed to acquire three hectares of land where she has cacao and barbasco crops.  When she began working on her own in this line of work she was able to make the most of her youth to work selflessly.

Elizabeth has been able to keep her crops in good condition, which allows her to produce export-quality cacao kernels.  To have a productive season she has to have the capital to buy supplies such as organic soil amendments and tools and to pay the workers who help her with a variety of tasks.  One of her main goals is to continue working with her characteristic motivation so she can buy one hectare of land to expand her cacao crop and, in the long run, improve her income.

This is Elizabeth's second loan from her financial institution and she's very grateful for their trust and this opportunity.  She wants 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es:
Liseth tiene 19 años, es madre soltera de su hijo de un año. Vive por el momento en casa de sus padres construida a base de madera. Se dedica al oficio de la agricultura hace 3 años. Con la llegada de su pequeño no tenía un oficio estable para mantenerse económicamente y fue por ello que recibió el apoyo de sus padres que le cedieron media hectárea de cultivo con plantaciones de cacao orgánico que empezó a trabajarlos de manera inmediata logrando obtener su primera producción en aquel entonces.
Es una labor que aprendió desde muy niña gracias a sus abuelos y debe de mantener los árboles en las mejores condiciones; es por ello que fertiliza sus terrenos de cultivo solo con abono orgánico.
Tiene la suerte de contar con parcelas de terreno muy fértiles que facilitan considerablemente su trabajo.
Desea con el tiempo reunir dinero mediante su humilde oficio para cumplir uno de sus principales objetivos que es adquirir un terreno y construir su propia vivienda. Es el primer préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y agradece desde ya la oportunidad que le brindan. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y herramientas para el buen mantenimiento de sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Liseth is 19 years old. She is the single  mother of a one year old boy. Right now she is living in her parents' house, built from wood. She has worked in agriculture for 3 years. With the arrival of her little one, she didn't have a stable job to support herself financially and that is why she received her parents' help. They gave her a half hectare of of organic cacao crops and she started to work it, immediately obtaining her first harvest. 

She learned this work from the time she was very young, thanks to her grandparents, and she has to keep the trees in the best condition. That is why she only fertilizes her cropland with organic fertilizer. She is lucky enough to have very fertile land which facilitates her job considerably. In time, she hopes to get enough money together through her humble trade to meet one of her main goals, which is to acquire a plot of land and build her own house. This is the first loan that she has asked her financial institution for and she is grateful for the opportunity they are offering her. At this time, she wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer and tools to maintain her cacao crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and farming tools.

loans.name: Magloria

texts.es: Magloria tiene 41 años, es divorciada madre de 3 pequeños hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha a base de material noble. Se dedica integralmente a la agricultura y producción de frutos rentables de su zona como el cacao, café, barbasco y palillo. Se inició hace más de 20 años junto a su esposo y apoyada por sus padres con dinero para la compra de su parcela. Años después se separó y asumió el doble rol para sus hijos sintiéndose muy motivada por esta gran oportunidad. Su parcela esta ubicada a 30 minutos de su localidad donde debe realizar una caminata para llegar y realizar sus labores cotidianas tales como la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus plantaciones, para ello cuenta con el apoyo de trabajadores ya que es una labor complicada y colectiva.
