Dominga works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Dominga requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Dominga is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. Elisa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elisa is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Elisa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Romulo works hard to support his family. He has a motorcycle transport business and earns additional money by selling fish.

Romulo has been supporting his business activities through his past eleven loans from NWTF. He is now applying for a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair his transport motorcycle like paints, steel bars, etc.

Romulo hopes that his hard work will help him build and expand his business so as to secure his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his transport motorcycle like paints, steel bars, etc.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a root crops business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of root crops to sell for her root crops business.

Vivencia has been in this business for 10 years. Vivencia earns additional income from selling coconut wine.

Vivencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of root crops to sell

loans.name: Feviana

texts.en:
Feviana is 48 years old and married with four children.

Feviana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks, such as snack foods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, canned goods, soy sauce, and other groceries to sell.

Feviana has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years, and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Feviana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, such as snack foods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, canned goods, soy sauce, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing a PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell in her buy-and-sell banana business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 7 years. Flordeliza earns more income from food vending.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Gaudencia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Gaudencia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Gaudencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 44 years old and five of her children are still in school.

Gemma has a selling dried fish business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Gemma has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 46 years old and widowed with five children.  With three children still in school, Glenda works very hard to provide for them.

Glenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Glenda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Glenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, salt, seasonings, meat, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for nine years now.

Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, salt, seasonings, meat, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mercedes works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.  Mercedes is borrowing 23000 HP through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials for her food vending business.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 48 years old and has four children. Rosita is married and has one child who is still in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been fattening pigs for six years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs
